Chez Thomas Gely
3 rue de la Villette
69003 Lyon, France

presentation.title: WYRDWALKERS
presentation.subtitle: The association mixing mythology and role-paying

playful.title: Fun
playful.text: With a whole role-paying game setting joining together 12 pantheons, more than 300 deities and around 700 detailed sheets in an entirely free wiki , Wyrdwalkers aims to introduce people to mythology through games and role-playing activities.

educational.title: Pedagogic
educational.text: Through initiation workshops about mythology, role-play or Storytelling, Wyrdwalkers sets some foundations allowing those who wish to dive deep inside eternal tales to study them and make up their own legends in order to share them and make them alive.

questions.title: Asking questions
questions.text: With its own system allowing for studies of philosophy, wyrdwalkers is also a place of questionning. Is music divine or human ? Is it natural to seek  immortality ? These questions and more can be answered in groups or through role-playing activities.

mythological.title: Mythological
mythological.text: Based on studies of different mythologies from all over the world, Wyrdwalkers makes myths and legends the core of its activities.

presentation.header: Wyrdwalkers aims to demonstrate the omnipresence of myths. Through Role-Play, but not just. Actually, Wyrdwalkers is all of those :

afterworks.title: Afterwork Murder Parties
afterworks.text: Do you want to find out who is behind Hades' demise ? Or who murdered King Arthur ? All of this between friends, colleagues or family ? Wyrdwalkers offers you to animate those events. They are suited as much for families searching for entertainment as well as work teams searching for a relaxed and fun moment. Between 5 and 20 players.

gn.title: Live Action Murder Parties
gn.text: A role-playing game, but Live Action. Become a part of major events several times a year and contribute into forging the Wyrdwalkers universe. Wether you witnessed the fall of Atlantis, King Arthur's demise or even the New World's discovery, your actions will be engraved forever in the Legend.

workshops.title: Storytelling Workshops
workshops.text: Myths are the tales a civilization tells to itself, about itself. Storytelling workshops teach a new way to write a story and build your own myths in order to share them afterwards. Whether you like fiction, theater plays or are an escape game creator, you will have the basics to exploit the whole power of myths.

campaigns.title: RPG Campaigns
campaigns.text: Pure moments of fun between friends, spent bashing hydras and Titanic cults. Live mythology as if you were in it, with all of its mysteries and legends.

animations.title: Animations (Lyon)
animations.text: Wyrdwalkers is a Lyon-based association and role-play is our favorite way of expression. You can find us at events such as Yggdrasil or Octogônes. Our GMs will be pleased to welcome you at their booth to intiate you to role-playing and/or the Wyrdwalkers setting.

triangle.title: A human study
triangle.text: In order to write the Wyrdwalkers setting et make it consistent, its creators studied over a dozen mythologies. From there was born a model giving us the ability to analyze the human condition, directly inspired by civilizations and tribes that came before. This model describes the three major paradoxes every human being has to face and allows us to understand the 'useful fictions' surrounding us in order to master them and invent new ones.

presentation.message: Wyrdwalkers is a Loi 1901 french association aiming to promote mythology through activities based on imagination, play and pedagogy.

home.text:
'Alright kid, grab a pint of Guinness - it’s imported, not the stale piss they make here - and let me tell you about this business of ours. The business of Legend. Our parents are up there, somewhere. Who’s your Divine Parent again? Mine’s the mighty Dagda, if it wasn’t already obvious from my devastating smile. Anyways, they’re up there, and they’re relying on us to get this World in order. It’s a real mess down here, if you hadn’t noticed.

Your main job is going to be what we like to call ‘Pest Control’. See, when Titans manage to sneak their spawn down here, they usually stay quiet and slowly gather cultists and power. They gnaw at the fabric of reality until something BIG comes through. When that happens, people die. Ever heard of the Black Plague? Yeah. So we take care of the pest before that happens. This city is a real hotbed for that kind of shit. Sometimes it’s a Vampire or a Lich, but it’s usually going to be some idiot kid with a pirated copy of 'Necromancy for Dummies' who summons a poltergeist and gets his brain scooped empty like a tub of ice cream at a fat kid’s birthday party.

There’s not many of us so you’ll probably have to work with the local population. Hopefully you can get the info and help you need from the usual witch convents and technodruid punks, but sometimes you need some extra oomph. That’s when the Secret Societies come in. They’re on no one’s side but their own, but they have information and resources. And they need us, because we got raw power that they don’t - we’re part God for dad’s sake! Just be wary of the Illuminati, they always find a way to make sure you pay more than you expected.

If you start walking around this world you’re bound to run into some Mythborns. Elves, werewolves, dragons, fey - I even met a were-kangaroo once! Bouncy bugger, but a great poker player. Though I’m pretty sure he was hiding extra aces in that pouch of his...Anyways, they’re like people - some are nice some not so much - but they generally have power and a trick up their sleeve. Stay friendly with them if you can - rumours move fast in their world.

But your greatest resource is always going to be your fellow Godborns. There’s not many of us, and life expectancy has never been great, so we gotta stick together. We’re bright shooting stars, and we try to write our names in the sky while we can. We all seek the same prize: Apotheosis, when a Godborn reaches full Godhood. Immortality, baby! I’m pretty sure if I make it, I’ll become God of Honor. Or Rugby. I’m not sure yet, still got a ways to go.

Pardon? ‘Why do people not notice there are Dragons and Demigods walking amongst them’? Oh it’s pretty simple. There’s no great masquerade or anything. It’s just that most people’s lives don’t matter - they’re background characters, really. They don’t contribute to the Legend, so they’re not included in it, it’s as simple as that. Unless you include them of course, and then they become linked to your Legend, but the plucky human sidekick rarely survives to the end of the story.

Anyways, I digress. Finish your pint, and let’s go to a little warehouse I’ve heard about. You ever punched a Fire Giant? Cause if we’re lucky you might get to tonight. Enjoy your time as a Demigod, and try not to cause too much devastation! It’s a lot of paperwork.'
